sanskrit_verse:
दूरादावसथान् मूत्रं दूरात्पादावसेचनम् ।
उच्छिष्टान्ननिषेकं च दूरादेव समाचरेत् ॥ ४.१५१॥
transliteration:
dūrād āvasathān mūtraṁ dūrāt pādāvasecanam |
ucchiṣṭānna-niṣekaṁ ca dūrādeva samācaret || 4.151||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must relieve oneself, wash one's feet, and dispose of leftover food only at a distance from dwelling places.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from spatial sanctity and environmental hygiene
Causation rooted in prevention of contamination and disorder
Capacity-based responsibility through conscious bodily regulation
Restoration logic via maintenance of communal cleanliness
Consciousness alignment with dharmic spatial discipline
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent_relief_location == within_dwelling_radius THEN action_prohibited = TRUE
IF agent_washing_location == within_dwelling_radius THEN action_prohibited = TRUE
IF agent_food_disposal_location == within_dwelling_radius THEN action_prohibited = TRUE
IF contamination_risk > threshold THEN mandatory_relocation = TRUE
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving public health, sanitation, or ritual purity, the Court must recognize that spatial conduct laws derive their validity directly from SPH as the Source-Authority. Violations are not crimes but misalignments requiring immediate restoration of秩序 through enforced distancing protocols.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes clear causality between improper disposal and environmental imbalance. The sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) of impurity arises only when proximity rules are violated. Responsibility is proportional to awareness of spatial dharma. No punitive consequence arises; only corrective realignment is enacted.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Mandatory completion of proper relief/washing/disposal at correct distance
Reintegration protocol through purification of contaminated zones
Assumption of spatial discipline responsibility by individual and community
Capacity restoration through repeated alignment with prescribed distances
final_declaration: This ordinance flows directly from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Law. Dharma is hereby restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
